conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand what the given x/t vs t graph represents.
The expression x/t can be rewritten in terms of velocity as follows: x/t = v, where x is the position, t is the time, v is the velocity.
From the given x/t vs t graph, we observe that it is a straight line passing through the origin with a positive slope.

premise: The graph is a straight line with a positive slope.
conclusion: This indicates that the velocity v is constant over time.

premise: To find the speed of the car at the end of the 2nd second, we need to determine the value of v from the graph.
conclusion: Identify the slope of the line.
At t = 0, the value of x/t is 10 m/s.

premise: The slope of the line gives us the velocity since x/t = v.
conclusion: The velocity v is constant and equal to 10 m/s from the graph.

premise: Since the velocity v is constant and equal to 10 m/s from the graph, the speed at any time within this interval will also be 10 m/s.
conclusion: Thus, the speed of the car at the end of the 2nd second is 10 m/s.
